description: The social science literature on organizations assessed through consideration of the major theoretical traditions and lines of research predominant in the field. For PhD students only.

name: Doctoral Research Seminar in Health Systems Modeling
description: Restricted to PhD students, or by consent of instructor. Doctoral research seminar covering current topics in health policy, health systems modeling, and health innovation. May be repeated for credit.

description: Design and application of computational models and techniques for assessing climate and energy policy, and for predicting the impacts of climate change. Topics include 1) best practices in research design, model design and selection; 2) types of mode...

name: Directed Reading and Research
description: Directed reading and research on a subject of mutual interest to student and faculty member. Available to undergraduate, master, and doctoral students. Student must clarify deliverables, units, and grading basis with faculty member before applicable...

name: Blockchain Technologies & Entrepreneurship
description: This course offers a concise, in-depth exploration of entrepreneurship in decentralized computing, focusing on the rapid advance of decentralized blockchain technology since Bitcoin's release in 2009. We'll examine relevant technological advancements...

name: Buy-Side Investing

name: Decision Analysis Seminar
description: Current research and related topics presented by doctoral students and invited speakers. May be repeated for credit. Prerequisite: 252.

name: Healthcare Systems Design

name: Entrepreneurial Thought Leaders' Seminar

name: Ases Breakthrough

name: Leadership Lab

name: The Stanford Energy Seminar
description: Interdisciplinary exploration of current energy challenges and opportunities in the context of development, equity and sustainability objectives. Talks are presented by faculty, visitors, and students and include relevant technology, policy, and syst...

name: Sustainable Energy Interdisciplinary Graduate Seminar
description: Graduate students will present their ongoing research to an audience of faculty and graduate students with a diversity of disciplinary perspectives regarding sustainable energy.

name: TGR Dissertation
description: For doctoral students in Terminal Graduate Residency (TGR) status only.
